item.title: ðŸš€ðŸŒš 2
item.description:
windows in my crib

tldr; window creation in zig made me sad, so i went with rust instead

a very good place to start

let’s start from the very beginning, and put a smile on julie andrews’ face. i set out to make this a rust app, then promptly got whispers of zig. heard about ghostty, got interested, cloned, reviewed, and got sad. ghostty, a terminal emulator written in zig (zig resources: book, karl seguin, ziglings) by mitch hashimoto (he flies a cirrus, by the way!!!) is currently avaialable for linux (wayland, i think), and mac. i looked around to see how window creation was handled and found it was handled natively.

item.title: ðŸš€ðŸŒš 1
item.description:
luna

tldr;
i made a browser so i can call my ex and win her back

to fully ascend to senior swe status, i have created a blog documenting my current projects, and i’m writing in the god-forsaken sentence.lower(obviously-python). this starts my journey of learning rust –notice i did not say “becoming a rustacean”. python will forever be in my heart, and until (if ever) zig changes its string primitive, it’ll remain only in my mind.

Khalil Mack

The Super Bowl has just occurred. One team is elated, one feels defeated, 30 are somewhere on a spectrum of “come on boys; next year is our year, for sure”, and “hey, we had no hope this year but at least we get great picks at the draft!”

While the season is still on everyone’s minds, the League gives its players a questionnaire with a simple question: name the top 100 players in the league this season!
